clinical_study.brief_title: Recovery Kinetics Following Change of Direction Training
clinical_study.official_title: Recovery Kinetics Following Change of Direction (COD) Training in Soccer: Implications for Different COD Angles

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims at investigating the recovery kinetics of skeletal muscle damage, neuromuscular fatigue and performance following a single change of direction (COD) training session in competitive soccer players. The impact of COD degrees will be also examined by comparing a 45o vs. 90o COD training session. Ten male soccer players will perform a COD45 [A single training session including 2x(10x ~27.6m) sprints with two 45o COD in each sprint], a COD90 [A single training session including 2x(10x ~21.2m) sprints with two 90o COD in each sprint] and a Control trial (No intervention included, only daily measurements) in randomized, repeated measures, crossover design. Assessments related to skeletal muscle damage, neuromuscular fatigue and performance will be performed prior to training session and daily for three consecutive days post-training, in each trial.

detailed_description.textblock: Ten male soccer players will be included in this study. Participants will be initially informed about the aim of study as well as the associated risks and benefits and subsequently will provide their signed consent form. At baseline, they will undergo assessment of their anthropometrics (i.e. body mass and body height), body composition (by DXA), physical conditioning status [maximal oxygen consumption (VO2max), Yo-Yo Intermittent Endurance test level 2 and Yo-Yo Intermittent Recovery test level 2] and daily dietary intake. Thereafter, they will participate in two experimental trials and one control trial in a randomized, crossover, repeated measures design: i) COD45: Participants in this trial will perform a COD training session consisted of 2 sets of 10 x ~27.6m sprints with two 45o COD in each sprint and a resting period of 16 sec and 2:20 min between sprints and sets, respectively, ii) COD90: Participants in this trial will perform a COD training session consisted of 2 sets of 10 x ~21.2m sprints with two 90o COD in each sprint and a resting period of 16 sec and 2:20 min between sprints and sets, respectively, iii) Control: Participants in this trial will only participate in daily assessments to control for day to day variability in the depended variables (they will not receive any intervention). Prior to each trial, participants will provide a resting blood sample (for the determination of blood lactate, white blood cell count and creatine kinase activity) and undergo assessment of their delayed onset of muscle soreness (DOMS), maximal voluntary isometric contraction (MVIC), countermovement jump [will be assessed using two force platforms at 1000 Hz and electromyography instrumentation (EMG)], isokinetic peak torque of knee extensors and flexors (will be assessed on an isokinetic dynamometer), agility (will be assessed using the Illinois test), 10m and 30m sprint time (will be assessed by using light cells) and repeated sprint ability (5x30m sprints will be performed with 25 sec rest in-between). In COD45 and COD90 experimental trials, a blood sample will be collected immediately post-training for the determination of blood lactate concentration while assessment of DOMS, MVIC and countermovement jump will be performed at 1, 2 and 3 hours post-training. In all trials assessment of DOMS, MVIC, countermovement jump (CMJ), isokinetic peak torque, agility and sprinting performance as well as determination of creatine kinase activity and white blood cell count will be performed at 24, 48 and 72 hours post-training. A 7-day wash out period will applied between trials.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in creatine kinase activity
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 24, 48 and 72 hours after change of direction training session
primary_outcome.description: Creatine kinase activity will be measured in plasma

primary_outcome.measure: Change in white blood cell count
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 24, 48 and 72 hours after change of direction training session
primary_outcome.description: White blood cell count will be measured by using an automatic blood analyzer

primary_outcome.measure: Change in delayed onset of muscle soreness
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 1, 2, 3, 24, 48 and 72 hours after change of direction training session
primary_outcome.description: Muscle soreness will be assessed by palpation of the muscle belly and the distal region

primary_outcome.measure: Change in isometric peak torque
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 1, 2, 3, 24, 48 and 72 hours after change of direction training session
primary_outcome.description: Isometric peak torque will be assessed on an isokinetic dynamometer

primary_outcome.measure: Change in fatigue index of maximal voluntary isometric contraction during 10 seconds
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 1, 2, 3, 24, 48 and 72 hours after change of direction training session
primary_outcome.description: Fatigue rate will be determined by calculating the percent drop of peak torque between the first and the last three seconds of a 10-second maximal isometric contraction

primary_outcome.measure: Change in isokinetic peak torque of knee extensors
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 24, 48 and 72 hours after change of direction training session
primary_outcome.description: Isokinetic peak torque will be assessed on an isokinetic dynamometer in both limbs

primary_outcome.measure: Change in isokinetic peak torque of knee flexors
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 24, 48 and 72 hours after change of direction training session
primary_outcome.description: Isokinetic peak torque will be assessed on an isokinetic dynamometer in both limbs

primary_outcome.measure: Change in countermovement jump height
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 1, 2, 3, 24, 48 and 72 hours after change of direction training session
primary_outcome.description: Countermovement jump height will be assessed by using two force platforms at 1000 Hz, with each foot in parallel on the two platforms providing a separate yet time-synchronized measurement of the jump height for each leg

primary_outcome.measure: Change in ground reaction force during countermovement jump
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 1, 2, 3, 24, 48 and 72 hours after change of direction training session
primary_outcome.description: Ground reaction force will be assessed by using two force platforms at 1000 Hz, with each foot in parallel on the two platforms providing a separate yet time-synchronized measurement of the jump height for each leg

primary_outcome.measure: Change in peak power during countermovement jump
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 1, 2, 3, 24, 48 and 72 hours after change of direction training session
primary_outcome.description: Peak power will be assessed using two force platforms at 1000 Hz, with each foot in parallel on the two platforms providing a separate yet time-synchronized measurement of the jump height for each leg

primary_outcome.measure: Change in mean power during countermovement jump
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 1, 2, 3, 24, 48 and 72 hours after change of direction training session
primary_outcome.description: Mean power will be assessed using two force platforms at 1000 Hz, with each foot in parallel on the two platforms providing a separate yet time-synchronized measurement of the jump height for each leg

primary_outcome.measure: Change in vertical stiffness during countermovement jump
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 1, 2, 3, 24, 48 and 72 hours after change of direction training session
primary_outcome.description: Vertical stiffness will be assessed using two force platforms at 1000 Hz, with each foot in parallel on the two platforms providing a separate yet time-synchronized measurement of the jump height for each leg

primary_outcome.measure: Change in peak rate of force development during countermovement jump
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 1, 2, 3, 24, 48 and 72 hours after change of direction training session
primary_outcome.description: Peak rate of force development will be assessed using two force platforms at 1000 Hz, with each foot in parallel on the two platforms providing a separate yet time-synchronized measurement of the jump height for each leg

primary_outcome.measure: Change in peak normalized electromyography (EMG) during the eccentric and concentric phases of the countermovement jump
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 1, 2, 3, 24, 48 and 72 hours after change of direction training session
primary_outcome.description: EMG data will be collected wirelessly at 2000 Hz using a Myon MA-320 EMG system (Myon AG, Switzerland) for the vastus lateralis, biceps femoris, gastrocnemius and gluteus maximus muscles.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in mean normalized electromyography (EMG) during the eccentric and concentric phases of the countermovement jump
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 1, 2, 3, 24, 48 and 72 hours after change of direction training session
primary_outcome.description: EMG data will be collected wirelessly at 2000 Hz using a Myon MA-320 EMG system (Myon AG, Switzerland) for the vastus lateralis, biceps femoris, gastrocnemius and gluteus maximus muscles.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in repeated sprint ability
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 24, 48 and 72 hours after change of direction training session
primary_outcome.description: Repeated sprint ability will be tested using 5x30 m sprints with 25 seconds rest in-between

primary_outcome.measure: Change in sprint time of 10m
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 24, 48 and 72 hours after change of direction training session
primary_outcome.description: 10m sprint time will be assessed using light cells

primary_outcome.measure: Change in sprint time of 30m
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 24, 48 and 72 hours after change of direction training session
primary_outcome.description: 30m sprint time will be assessed using light cells

primary_outcome.measure: Change in agility
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 24, 48 and 72 hours after change of direction training session
primary_outcome.description: Agility will be assessed using the illinois agility test.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in field activity during the change of direction training session
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the change of direction training session
primary_outcome.description: Field activity will be continuously monitored during the change of direction training session by using global positioning system (GPS)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in heart rate during the change of direction training session
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the change of direction training session
primary_outcome.description: Heart rate will be continuously monitored during the change of direction training session by using heart rate monitors.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in blood lactate concentration
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and immediately post change of direction training session
primary_outcome.description: Blood lactate will be measured using a lactate plus system

secondary_outcome.description: Body mass will me measured on a beam balance with stadiometer
Body height will me measured on a beam balance with stadiometer
Body fat will be assessed by using Dual-emission X-ray absorptiometry
Lean body mass will be assessed by using Dual-emission X-ray absorptiometry
VO2max will be measured by open circuit spirometry via breath by breath method

secondary_outcome.measure: Yo-Yo Intermittent Endurance Test level 2 performance
Yo-Yo Intermittent Recovery Test level 2 performance

secondary_outcome.description: Dietary intake will be assessed over a 7-day period by using diet recalls

arm_group.description: Participants in this arm will receive no intervention
Participants in this arm will participate in a COD training session consisted of 45 degrees changes of direction
Participants in this arm will participate in a COD training session consisted of 90 degrees changes of direction

intervention.description: Participants will perform 2 sets of 10 sprints. The total distance for each sprint will be 27.6 meters and will include two changes of direction of 45 degrees. The recovery time will be 16 seconds between sprints and 2.20 minutes between sets

Participants will perform 2 sets of 10 sprints. The total distance for each sprint will be 21.2 meters and will include two changes of direction of 90 degrees. The recovery time will be 16 seconds between sprints and 2.20 minutes between sets

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Soccer players participating in at least 5 training sessions per week and 1official match
- Participation at a competitive level for at least 4 years
- Free of musculoskeletal injuries
- No use of ergogenic supplements or medication
- Non-smokers
Exclusion Criteria:
- Musculoskeletal injury
- Use of alcohol, caffeine and any type of ergogenic supplements or medication during the course of the study

overall_official.affiliation: University of Thessaly, Department of Physical Education and Sport Science

facility.name: SMART LAB, Department of Physical Education and Sports Science, University of Thessaly.
SmArT LABORATORY, SCHOOL OF PHYSICAL EDUCATION & SPORTS SCIENCES, UNIVERSITY OF THESSALY
